attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish

attributes.action: Urge the Government to support the construction of a Sudbury bypass.
attributes.background: The town of Sudbury, Suffolk has suffered from heavy congestion for too long, hampering the development of the town, causing dangerous levels of pollution and reducing the living standards of its residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Sudbury Bypass Campaign already has a strong initial business case, the support of Suffolk County Council, the New Anglia Local Enterprise Partnership and the Haven Gateway Partnership.

This petition asks that the Government provides support for the construction of a Sudbury bypass, including any necessary funding, to improve the future of the town and surrounding areas.

attributes.action: Make gender neutral uniforms compulsory in UK schools
attributes.background: Across the UK, children are unnecessarily, and directly discriminated against in schools, simply because of their gender. Despite various acts of parliament, schools in the UK are still able to dictate what a child of a certain gender can wear. This is most unfitting in 21st century Britain.
attributes.additional_details: However, British schools are prescribed to teach British values. Most notably, individual liberty, and mutual respect. Yet, such values are compromised if, for example, boys cannot wear skirts, or girls are unable to wear trousers. Not least, in some uniform policies boys cannot wear earrings, or possess long hair, whereas girls at the same institution can. Such uniforms also put those children who do not identify as either a boy, or a girl at risk. Attitudes towards gender need to change.

attributes.action: UK Government to pass a law requiring Vets to scan all newly registered animals.
attributes.background:
In March this year my British Shorthair Tabby disappeared.  Extensive searches were made contacting all organisations. On targetting Veterinary Surgeries not all were routinely scanning newly registered cats and dogs which was concerning.
I want any suspected thefts to be reported to the Police.
attributes.additional_details: Subsequently another two similar profile cats have disappeared within 0.5miles of my rural community. While these incidents have been reported to local Police their hands are tied and limited with what they can actually do. This loophole allows unscrupulous thieves to identify themselves as the owners thus depriving the true owners of their treasured pets. Kennel Club figures for 2014 show 70,000 animals missing/stolen and Direct Line figures for 2015/16 show cat theft up by 40% and the true numbers of thefts nearer 360,000. Only 10% of cats were retrieved by microchip which in large part is due to the inconsistency of scanning newly registered animals.

attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren)
attributes.background: Abusive partners should lose the privilege to have contact with their child(ren) if the mother is forced to flee domestic abuse whilst she is pregnant or whilst the child is too young to choose for themselves.
attributes.additional_details: Abusive ex partners also use children as a gateway back into their victims life. Safeguarding restrictions being put in place is not sufficient. If the child has contact with the abusive parent, they are very likely to be exposed to domestic abuse when observing the parent in future relationships. This can be damaging and is not in a child's best interest. The abuser may also abuse the child or use the child to indirectly continue to abuse their ex partner.

attributes.action: Prevent the media from naming alleged sex offenders, unless they are convicted
attributes.background:
The media publish the names, photos, and other details of alleged sex offenders during their trials.  Their future life is ruined regardless of the outcome while the alleged victim gets lifelong anonymity.

We believe this is unfair and the accused's identity should be protected unless convicted.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ibblaw.co.uk/insights/blog/man-cleared-rape-urges-anonymity-accused (24th March 2017)

http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/uk-world-news/footballer-ched-evans-cleared-rape-12026611 (14th October 2016)

attributes.background: Muslims believe that Eid should be a national holiday as it is a religious celebration similar to Christmas. Many people believe this from Muslims to even none Muslims.

attributes.action: End free movement of pets to UK to prevent parasite blinding people and pets.
attributes.background: The pet passport scheme allows EU pets to pass through borders without quarantine allowing the spread of an oriental eye worm that blinds both animals and people. We must quarantine travelling animals and treat them if infected. Infections in humans have been reported throughout mainland Europe.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are the main reason huge tracts of rainforest are destroyed every day, releasing huge amounts of carbon into the atmosphere. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Refined palm oil also contains large amounts of harmful fatty acid esters, known to cause cancer.

attributes.action: Stop oversized and hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel
attributes.background: We’re a logistics business headquartered in Dartford and we’ve officially had enough of the Dartford traffic jam. Our simple solution: Stop oversized & hazardous goods vehicles using the Dartford Tunnel.
attributes.additional_details:
We propose a simple solution: Stop the Convoys and get Dartford moving. Traffic at the Dartford Tunnel is brought to a standstill on average 100 times a day by a small number of oversized & hazardous goods vehicles which need to be escorted through the tunnel, in a convoy. 
Each convoy can take up to 2.5 mins to travel through the tunnel, and a tunnel is closed around every 15 mins. 
Why should 99% of drivers suffer due to less than 1% of vehicles? 
Our suggestion is simple: Stop these oversized/hazardous vehicles using the tunnel & send them the other way around the M25.

attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme – intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain – after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.background:
It would eliminate “black markets” and allow easier monetary policy.
Underground economy in the UK is worth +/- £150bn a year.
It could easily solve problems with the NHS, social housing, investment in research, education etc.
attributes.additional_details:
It would help to “wipe off “ undeclared work and organised crime income.
Cash transactions are less popular each year.
Let’s make the UK a leader and be the first Cashless Nation.

attributes.action: Put aspects of gardening onto the Primary curriculum, teaching its benefits.
attributes.background: I introduced a motion on a similar topic at a Teachers' Conference last year, which gained much national publicity. Not all schools have a garden but all can do something in aa container or similar. Help can be given by the RHS Campaign for School Gardening and similar campaigns.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that outdoor learning can improve the mental health of particpants, and introducing children to New healthy foods can help to reduce obesity.

attributes.action: Scrap the OISC and extend the remit of the SRA to Immigration Advisers
attributes.background: The Office of Immigration Services Commissioner (OISC) is sponsored by the Home Office and regulates immigration advisers, professionals that do an important job and many are more specialised than solicitors. I believe the OISC operates in a secretive, undemocratic, biased and unfair manner.
attributes.additional_details:
It's powers are hardly challenged as it has many powers.

The fact this body quietly operates with professionals that do not have much legal knowledge can leave professionals open to unfair treatment. Surprisingly they almost always win cases in court. This cannot be right. The Home Office itself with much more infrastructure does not have this level of precision.
